intro: Agoseris apargioides var. eastwoodiae, commonly known as Eastwood's agoseris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. This variety is distinguished by its unique morphological traits and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
